channel.title: Xbox 360; Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion; Question
channel.description:
I see the game for 14.99 at GameStop. That's just the regular game. Then I scrolled down the page a bit and I saw the Game of the Year edition.
My question is:
Should I get the Game of the Year edition?
or
Should I get the Regular game?

item.title: Xbox 360; Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion; Question
item.dc:creator: @Statik97 Statik97
item.description:
@Statik97 wrote:

i got the normal game… get the normal one, its fun but gets boring in a while playing it alot. Thiers tons of gameplay, so if you max out your charecter, just buy the expansions with microsoft points seperatly :). Thats what I did and it worked fine for me

Read full topic
item.source: Xbox 360; Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion; Question

item.title: Xbox 360; Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion; Question
item.dc:creator: @Tomkruz Tomkruz
item.description:
@Tomkruz wrote:

[quote=“T3arful, post:4, topic:323645”][quote author=`Aaron link=topic=420050.msg3085603#msg3085603 date=1262473038]
No difference, buy any of them.
[/quote]
No… Game of the year edition has the expansion packs as well. The normal oblivion is without the expansion packs, which you then have to purchase separately.[/quote]

Yeah, i bought the game of the year edition

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360; Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion; Question
item.dc:creator: @T3arful T3arful
item.description:
@T3arful wrote:

`Aaron:

No difference, buy any of them.

No… Game of the year edition has the expansion packs as well. The normal oblivion is without the expansion packs, which you then have to purchase separately.
